definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: And when I said hello to cashiers and clerks, I got better service.
sentences.chinese: 当我向出纳员或店员问好时，能得到更优质的服务。

sentences.english: The teller then takes the withdrawal slip to a bank officer for approval.
sentences.chinese: 然后出纳员将此取款单交给银行主管人以获得批准。

sentences.english: After robbing the till for months the cashier was found out.
sentences.chinese: 那出纳员从钱柜里偷钱偷了好几个月后才被发现。

sentences.english: Since my graduation from the school two years ago, I ahve been employed in the Green Hotel as a cashier.
sentences.chinese: 两年前，自从离校后，在格兰酒店担任出纳员。

sentences.english: Salaries were disbursed by the paymaster's office.
sentences.chinese: 薪金已由工薪出纳员办公室发放。

sentences.english: The letter at Counter 6will pay you against your number slip.
sentences.chinese: 六号栏柜的出纳员将根据你的号头牌给付你钱。

sentences.english: The teller told me I need to sign these forms.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员告诉我得签这些表格。

sentences.english: Cashier was found guilty of peculation and removed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员被发现犯了盗用公款罪便被解除了职务。

sentences.english: What time must it be when the escaped hungry wolf ate the paymaster?
sentences.chinese: 流亡的饿狼会在什么时分吃掉出纳员？

sentences.english: The cashier embezzled ＄ 50,000 from the bank.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员盗用了银行5万美元。

sentences.english: The cashier will pay you according to your number.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员将根据你的号码付给你钱。

sentences.english: The teller can see how much money is in my checking and savings accounts.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员可以看到我的支票和储蓄账户上还有多少钱。

sentences.english: For months the cashier had been falsifying the accounts, but then the company found him out.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员几个月来一直在做假帐，但后来被公司发现了。

sentences.english: The lines in front of the tellers were four deep.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员前的排队队伍，每条都是四层深。

sentences.english: The robber asked the cashier to put the money into the sack.
sentences.chinese: 那个抢劫犯让出纳员把钱放进袋子里。

sentences.english: One of the bank's tellers has defalcated with $50,000 of the bank.
sentences.chinese: 银行中一位出纳员盗用了银行5万美元。

definition: cashier/to receive and hand over payment/to lend and borrow books
